dt: {bc}a state of intense or overwhelming fear

dt.t: He lived in {wi}terror{/wi} of being caught.

dt: {bc}violence or the threat of violence used as a weapon of intimidation or coercion
{bc}violent or destructive acts (such as bombing) committed by groups in order to intimidate a population or government into granting their demands

dt.t: I stood before fierce Mrs. Mabel Johnston, his secretary and the {wi}terror{/wi} of the office.
Before rifles were available to Eskimo hunters, bears were truly the {wi}terror{/wi} of their existence.

dt: {bc}an extremely disruptive or annoying person or thing

pt: {sc}fear{/sc} {sc}dread{/sc} {sc}fright{/sc} {sc}alarm{/sc} {sc}panic{/sc} {sc}terror{/sc} {sc}trepidation{/sc} mean painful agitation in the presence or anticipation of danger. {sc}fear{/sc} is the most general term and implies anxiety and usually loss of courage.
{sc}dread{/sc} usually adds the idea of intense reluctance to face or meet a person or situation and suggests aversion as well as anxiety.
{sc}fright{/sc} implies the shock of sudden, startling fear.
{sc}alarm{/sc} suggests a sudden and intense awareness of immediate danger.
{sc}panic{/sc} implies unreasoning and overmastering fear causing hysterical activity.
{sc}terror{/sc} implies the most extreme degree of fear.
{sc}trepidation{/sc} adds to {sc}dread{/sc} the implications of timidity, trembling, and hesitation.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}terrour{/it}, from Latin {it}terror{/it}, from {it}terrēre{/it} to frighten; akin to Greek {it}trein{/it} to be afraid, flee, {it}tremein{/it} to tremble {ma}{mat|tremble|}{/ma}
shortdef: a state of intense or overwhelming fear

violence or the threat of violence used as a weapon of intimidation or coercion; especially : violent or destructive acts (such as bombing) committed by groups in order to intimidate a population or government into granting their demands —sometimes used before another noun
a very frightening or terrifying aspect

dt: {bc}a sudden awakening in dazed terror that occurs in children during slow-wave sleep, is often preceded by a sudden shrill cry uttered in sleep, and is not remembered when the child awakes

shortdef: a sudden awakening in dazed terror that occurs in children during slow-wave sleep, is often preceded by a sudden shrill cry uttered in sleep, and is not remembered when the child awakes —usually used in plural

dt: {bc}a state or a period of time marked by violence often committed by those in power that produces widespread terror

et: {it}Reign of Terror{/it}, a period of the French Revolution that was conspicuous for mass executions of political suspects
shortdef: a state or a period of time marked by violence often committed by those in power that produces widespread terror
a child who behaves very badly

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or being measures taken to combat or prevent terrorism {bc}{sx|counterterrorist|counterterrorist|}

shortdef: of, relating to, or being measures taken to combat or prevent terrorism : counterterrorist

dt: {bc}to be something that someone is not afraid of

shortdef: to be something that someone is not afraid of
